{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Tax Analyst",
  "description": "Carry1st is Africa&rsquo;s leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3, we scale awesome content in underserved frontier markets. Carry1st has a proprietary payments and ecommerce platform which allows players to acquire global content using locally-accessible payment methods. We are backed by awesome investors like: Andreessen Horowitz, Google, Riot Games, Avenir, Konvoy Ventures, and Nas.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Tax Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria (Remote)

Job Summary


	The Tax Analyst supports the company&rsquo;s multi-jurisdictional tax compliance and reporting activities across Africa, MENA, and the U.S. holding entity.
	This role ensures accurate and timely tax filings, supports transfer pricing documentation, manages correspondence with tax authorities, and contributes to optimizing the group&rsquo;s overall tax efficiency..&nbsp;


You will


	Prepare, review, and file all relevant tax returns across multiple jurisdictions, ensuring full compliance with local regulations.
	Support transfer pricing documentation, including intercompany agreements, benchmarking, and local file preparation in line with applicable global and local rules.
	Liaise with external tax advisors and local tax authorities to manage queries, audits, and assessments efficiently.
	Maintain tax records, reconciliations, and schedules for statutory audits and group reporting purposes.
	Assist in developing and implementing tax processes and automation initiatives to improve accuracy, compliance, and reporting efficiency.


Requirements
What makes you a great candidate?


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	4+ years of experience in corporate tax, preferably within a multinational, e-commerce, or digital platform business.
	Working knowledge of tax regulations in multiple African jurisdictions; familiarity with U.S. group reporting or international tax principles is a plus
	Strong Excel skills and detail-oriented analytical abilities
	Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
	Energetic, ready to contribute during growth
	Self-starter, reliable team-player, flexible and supportive


What will it be like to work at Carry1st?
Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship consumer fintech platform in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 15+ different countries. At Carry1st you will...


	Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
	Grow with a VC-backed startup
	Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
	Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create&nbsp;


Some additional perks&hellip;


	Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
	Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively&nbsp;
	Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
	Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
	Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
	Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day.&nbsp;&nbsp;
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Carry1st"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Enugu, Lagos, Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190575"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Tax Analyst Job at Carry1st




        
    

        
        Carry1st is Africa’s leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3, we scale awesome content in underserved frontier markets. Carry1st has a proprietary payments and ecommerce platform which allows players to acquire global content using locally-accessible payment methods. We are backed by awesome investors like: Andreessen Horowitz, Google, Riot Games, Avenir, Konvoy Ventures, and Nas.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax Analyst

Job Location: Nigeria (Remote)

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Tax Analyst supports the company’s multi-jurisdictional tax compliance and reporting activities across Africa, MENA, and the U.S. holding entity.
	This role ensures accurate and timely tax filings, supports transfer pricing documentation, manages correspondence with tax authorities, and contributes to optimizing the group’s overall tax efficiency.. 


You will


	Prepare, review, and file all relevant tax returns across multiple jurisdictions, ensuring full compliance with local regulations.
	Support transfer pricing documentation, including intercompany agreements, benchmarking, and local file preparation in line with applicable global and local rules.
	Liaise with external tax advisors and local tax authorities to manage queries, audits, and assessments efficiently.
	Maintain tax records, reconciliations, and schedules for statutory audits and group reporting purposes.
	Assist in developing and implementing tax processes and automation initiatives to improve accuracy, compliance, and reporting efficiency.


Requirements
What makes you a great candidate?


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	4+ years of experience in corporate tax, preferably within a multinational, e-commerce, or digital platform business.
	Working knowledge of tax regulations in multiple African jurisdictions; familiarity with U.S. group reporting or international tax principles is a plus
	Strong Excel skills and detail-oriented analytical abilities
	Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
	Energetic, ready to contribute during growth
	Self-starter, reliable team-player, flexible and supportive


What will it be like to work at Carry1st?
Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship consumer fintech platform in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 15+ different countries. At Carry1st you will...


	Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
	Grow with a VC-backed startup
	Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
	Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create 


Some additional perks…


	Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
	Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively 
	Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
	Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
	Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
	Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day.  
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

                        Fund Manager Job at CityCode Mortgage Bank Limited
                        Internal Control Manager Job at Genesis Group

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility Manager",
  "description": "Fort Knox Outsourcing was set up to cater to the growing need of businesses in Nigeria to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a &ldquo;Third Party Service Provider&rdquo; that sources, selects, and Second employment-ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island (with one site in Apapa), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Properties Under Management:
The successful candidate will manage the following sites:


	A 5-story commercial building
	One corporate office
	One residential building
	Two residential apartments
	One storage facility (Apapa)


Responsibilities


	&nbsp;Oversee daily facility operations across all assigned sites
	Manage maintenance activities, including preventive and corrective repairs
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations
	Supervise and coordinate vendors, contractors, and service providers
	Monitor facility budgets, utility usage, and operational expenses
	Conduct regular inspections to identify issues and enforce standards
	Address tenant concerns promptly to ensure satisfaction and retention
	Maintain accurate records, reports, and documentation for all facilities
	Ensure security, cleaning, and waste management services run efficiently
	Recommend and implement improvements to enhance facility performance


Requirements


	&nbsp;HND / BSc in Facility Management, Engineering, Estate Management, or related field
	&nbsp;Proven experience managing multi-site commercial and residential properties (preferably in Lagos)
	&nbsp;Strong knowledge of building systems, maintenance procedures, and vendor management
	&nbsp;Good understanding of HSE regulations and compliance requirements
	&nbsp;Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills
	&nbsp;Ability to multitask and manage multiple locations effectively


Salary
N500,000 &ndash; N600,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Facility Manager Job at Fort Knox Outsourcing




        
    

        
        Fort Knox Outsourcing was set up to cater to the growing need of businesses in Nigeria to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a “Third Party Service Provider” that sources, selects, and Second employment-ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location: Lagos Island (with one site in Apapa), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Properties Under Management:
The successful candidate will manage the following sites:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A 5-story commercial building
	One corporate office
	One residential building
	Two residential apartments
	One storage facility (Apapa)


Responsibilities


	 Oversee daily facility operations across all assigned sites
	Manage maintenance activities, including preventive and corrective repairs
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations
	Supervise and coordinate vendors, contractors, and service providers
	Monitor facility budgets, utility usage, and operational expenses
	Conduct regular inspections to identify issues and enforce standards
	Address tenant concerns promptly to ensure satisfaction and retention
	Maintain accurate records, reports, and documentation for all facilities
	Ensure security, cleaning, and waste management services run efficiently
	Recommend and implement improvements to enhance facility performance


Requirements


	 HND / BSc in Facility Management, Engineering, Estate Management, or related field
	 Proven experience managing multi-site commercial and residential properties (preferably in Lagos)
	 Strong knowledge of building systems, maintenance procedures, and vendor management
	 Good understanding of HSE regulations and compliance requirements
	 Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills
	 Ability to multitask and manage multiple locations effectively


Salary
N500,000 – N600,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Locations:&nbsp;Warri - Delta and Ado-ekiti - Ekiti
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Identify and pursue new sales opportunities through research, networking, and outreach.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	Conduct market research to understand trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Prepare and deliver compelling business proposals and presentations.
	Collaborate with internal teams to align marketing and sales strategies.
	Negotiate and close deals that support company objectives.
	Meet or exceed set sales targets and performance metrics.
	Provide regular reports and updates to management on business development activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing or a related field
	Minimum of 1&ndash;3 years of experience in business development, sales, or a related role.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Goal-oriented with the ability to meet deadlines and targets.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM tools.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving abilities.


Benefits


	Competitive salary (N120,000 - N150,000 monthly)&nbsp;and commission structure.
	Opportunity for career growth and professional development.
	Vibrant and collaborative work environment.
	Access to ongoing training and support.

Business Development Executive Job at Pwan Group




        
    

        
        PWAN GROUP is a conglomerate of different affiliate companies, and the brainchild of PWAN HOMES LIMITED. The Company has evolved into a choice Real Estate Developing and Marketing Company with a reputation for integrity, responsibility and excellence in service. The Headquarters of the PWAN Group is in Sangotedo- Ajah, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Executive

Job Locations: Warri - Delta and Ado-ekiti - Ekiti
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify and pursue new sales opportunities through research, networking, and outreach.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	Conduct market research to understand trends, competitor activities, and customer needs.
	Prepare and deliver compelling business proposals and presentations.
	Collaborate with internal teams to align marketing and sales strategies.
	Negotiate and close deals that support company objectives.
	Meet or exceed set sales targets and performance metrics.
	Provide regular reports and updates to management on business development activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing or a related field
	Minimum of 1–3 years of experience in business development, sales, or a related role.
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Goal-oriented with the ability to meet deadlines and targets.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM tools.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving abilities.


Benefits


	Competitive salary (N120,000 - N150,000 monthly) and commission structure.
	Opportunity for career growth and professional development.
	Vibrant and collaborative work environment.
	Access to ongoing training and support.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should foward their CVs to: hr@pwanhomes.com using the Job Position and the Location as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Credit Control Officer",
  "description": "Cedarcrest Hospitals Limited was founded in Abuja in January, 2008. The hospital started as a mono specialty centre and was formerly known as Cedarcrest Orthopaedic Clinics Ltd. Within a few years the hospital expanded its scope of services and has become a leading private multispecialty hospital. The core vision of the organisation is to provide world class specialist healthcare services to patients in Nigeria and the West African sub region.

Cedarcrest Hospitals Ltd currently has four hospitals located in Abuja, Lagos, Kainji and Jebba having over one hundred (100) bed capacity without patient camps in several other cities across Nigeria. Our services and facilities span several specialities and include emergency / trauma centre, radiology diagnostic centre, prosthetic manufacturing plant, oxygen manufacturing plant, modular surgical operating theatres, gastrointestinal endoscopy suite and several other facilities that make for a modern multispecialty hospital.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Description


	The Credit Control Officer is responsible for managing the hospital&rsquo;s credit policies and receivables, ensuring timely collection of outstanding balances from patients, HMOs, corporate clients, and other third-party payers.
	The role ensures financial compliance, proper documentation, accurate reconciliation of patient accounts, and effective communication with internal stakeholders and external partners to reduce bad debt exposure and enhance cash flow and financial performance.


Qualifications


	Educational Requirements:
	
		Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field.
		Professional certification or part-qualification in ICAN, ACCA, or CITN is an added advantage.
	
	
	Experience:
	
		Minimum of 2 &ndash; 5 years of experience in credit control, accounts receivables, or financial operations within a hospital or service-based environment (healthcare experience strongly preferred).
	
	
	Technical Skills:
	
		Strong knowledge of billing systems, insurance claims, and healthcare credit cycle management.
		Proficiency in MS Excel and accounting/ERP software.
	
	
	Key Competencies:
	
		High attention to detail and accuracy
		Excellent negotiation and communication skills
		Strong analytical, reporting and documentation skills
		Customer service orientation with firmness and professionalism
		Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
	
	


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@cedarcresthospitals.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "CEDARCREST HOSPITALS LIMITED"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "190572"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Credit Control Officer Job at Cedarcrest Hospitals Limited




        
    

        
        Cedarcrest Hospitals Limited was founded in Abuja in January, 2008. The hospital started as a mono specialty centre and was formerly known as Cedarcrest Orthopaedic Clinics Ltd. Within a few years the hospital expanded its scope of services and has become a leading private multispecialty hospital. The core vision of the organisation is to provide world class specialist healthcare services to patients in Nigeria and the West African sub region.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Cedarcrest Hospitals Ltd currently has four hospitals located in Abuja, Lagos, Kainji and Jebba having over one hundred (100) bed capacity without patient camps in several other cities across Nigeria. Our services and facilities span several specialities and include emergency / trauma centre, radiology diagnostic centre, prosthetic manufacturing plant, oxygen manufacturing plant, modular surgical operating theatres, gastrointestinal endoscopy suite and several other facilities that make for a modern multispecialty hospital.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Control Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Description


	The Credit Control Officer is responsible for managing the hospital’s credit policies and receivables, ensuring timely collection of outstanding balances from patients, HMOs, corporate clients, and other third-party payers.
	The role ensures financial compliance, proper documentation, accurate reconciliation of patient accounts, and effective communication with internal stakeholders and external partners to reduce bad debt exposure and enhance cash flow and financial performance.


Qualifications


	Educational Requirements:
	
		Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or related field.
		Professional certification or part-qualification in ICAN, ACCA, or CITN is an added advantage.
	
	
	Experience:
	
		Minimum of 2 – 5 years of experience in credit control, accounts receivables, or financial operations within a hospital or service-based environment (healthcare experience strongly preferred).
	
	
	Technical Skills:
	
		Strong knowledge of billing systems, insurance claims, and healthcare credit cycle management.
		Proficiency in MS Excel and accounting/ERP software.
	
	
	Key Competencies:
	
		High attention to detail and accuracy
		Excellent negotiation and communication skills
		Strong analytical, reporting and documentation skills
		Customer service orientation with firmness and professionalism
		Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
	
	


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@cedarcresthospitals.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Engineer",
  "description": "Moniepoint Incorporated is a global business payments and banking platform and recently became QED Investors&rsquo; first investment in Africa. We are the partner of choice for over 600,000 businesses of all sizes, powering the dreams of SMBs and providing them with equal access to the tools they need to grow and scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

What you will get to do


	Build and maintain robust data pipelines processing large volumes of data
	Update and optimise our data platform for speed, scalability and cost
	Coordinate with different functional teams to understand and meet their data needs
	Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy
	Solve general data-related problems


To succeed in this role, you should have


	A bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or any other related field
	Proven experience as a Data Engineer (5+ years, can be made up for with accomplishments)
	Strong problem solving skills
	Advanced proficiency with SQL
	Proficiency with Python
	Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)
	Experience using version control tools such as git
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques


Experience With The Following Would Be a Plus:


	Data governance
	Building and deploying machine learning models
	Terraform or other infrastructure as code tools.


What To Expect In The Hiring Process:


	Application &amp; portfolio review: We assess your experience, creativity, and ability to produce high-quality motion work.
	Preliminary phone call with the recruiter: a brief conversation to discuss your background, interests, and expectations.
	Design Interview: a deep dive into motion process, toolkits, decision-making, and collaboration approach.
	Motion Design Challenge: a brief, open-ended scenario to assess motion craft, systems thinking, and communication.
	Final executive conversation: a discussion with senior leadership to assess your systems alignment, vision, and culture fit.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Moniepoint"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190571"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Data Engineer Job at Moniepoint




        
    

        
        Moniepoint Incorporated is a global business payments and banking platform and recently became QED Investors’ first investment in Africa. We are the partner of choice for over 600,000 businesses of all sizes, powering the dreams of SMBs and providing them with equal access to the tools they need to grow and scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

What you will get to do
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Build and maintain robust data pipelines processing large volumes of data
	Update and optimise our data platform for speed, scalability and cost
	Coordinate with different functional teams to understand and meet their data needs
	Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy
	Solve general data-related problems


To succeed in this role, you should have


	A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or any other related field
	Proven experience as a Data Engineer (5+ years, can be made up for with accomplishments)
	Strong problem solving skills
	Advanced proficiency with SQL
	Proficiency with Python
	Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)
	Experience using version control tools such as git
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques


Experience With The Following Would Be a Plus:


	Data governance
	Building and deploying machine learning models
	Terraform or other infrastructure as code tools.


What To Expect In The Hiring Process:


	Application & portfolio review: We assess your experience, creativity, and ability to produce high-quality motion work.
	Preliminary phone call with the recruiter: a brief conversation to discuss your background, interests, and expectations.
	Design Interview: a deep dive into motion process, toolkits, decision-making, and collaboration approach.
	Motion Design Challenge: a brief, open-ended scenario to assess motion craft, systems thinking, and communication.
	Final executive conversation: a discussion with senior leadership to assess your systems alignment, vision, and culture fit.
